sources.data_found: DataUSA (IPEDS data): Reporting 2022 Computer Science degrees awarded: 174 Bachelors, 51 Masters, 7 Research Doctorates. (Used for graduate program size estimation where official current enrollment counts are not published).

student_data.notes: Official CS enrollment headcount is not published on the public department page. Counts are estimated from degrees awarded in the 2023-2024 Common Data Set and IPEDS data. Undergrad: 209 Bachelor's degrees awarded (CDS 23-24) × 4 years = 836. MS: ~51 Master's degrees (IPEDS/DataUSA) × 2 years = 102. PhD: ~7 PhD degrees (IPEDS/DataUSA) × 6 years (avg duration) = 42. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: 4 nodes with 2x K80 each (Legacy hardware in BlueHive cluster)

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU counts calculated from the 'GPU Nodes' section of the CIRC BlueHive Technical Specifications page. 
- V100: 24 nodes × 4 GPUs = 96.
- A100: 2 nodes × 4 GPUs = 8 (Specs list 40GB variant).
- A40: 2 nodes × 8 GPUs = 16.
- K80: 4 nodes × 2 GPUs = 8. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: The primary GPU resource is the CIRC 'BlueHive' cluster. Data is sourced from the CIRC Technical Specifications page. Student counts are estimated from the 2023-2024 Common Data Set degree completions as specific enrollment tables for the CS department were not publicly accessible.
